But since both parents are the same (heterozygous), all gametes are equally likely. Each gene pair is independent, right? So for each gene, the probability of getting the correct allele is 1/2. Since there are five independent pairs, I think we multiply the probabilities together. That would be (1/2)^5 = 1/32.

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

(b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

G. 1/64, 1/4, 342/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

The questions are asking about probabilities related to self-fertilization. Let me break them down one by one. Starting with part (a): What's the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to the parent? Since the organism is heterozygous for all five genes, self-fertilization would mean each gamete has a 50% chance of being either the allele from the mother or the father. But since both parents are the same (heterozygous), all gametes are equally likely. Each gene pair is independent, right? So for each gene, the probability of getting the correct allele is 1/2. Since there are five independent pairs, I think we multiply the probabilities together. That would be (1/2)^5 = 1/32.

Hmm, but wait, let me make sure. For each gene, there are two possibilities, so yes, 1/2 for each, multiplied across all five gives 1/32. So part (a)'s answer should be 1/32.

Moving on to part (b): What proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? Homozygous means both alleles are the same, like AA or aa. For each gene pair, the probability of homozygosity is (1/2)*(1/2) + (1/2)*(1/2) = 1/4. Wait, no, actually, when considering both genes independently, the probability that a particular gene is homozygous is 1/4, as you can get AA or aa. But since the organisms are diploid for multiple genes, but each gene pair is independent, the overall probability of homozygosity would be the product of the probabilities for each gene. Because each gene must be homozygous for the entire individual to be homozygous. So, for each of the five genes, the probability is 1/4, so overall it's (1/4)^5. Wait, no, that doesn't sound right because each gene pair is independent. Actually, each gene needs to contribute a homozygous result. So, for each gene, the probability that it's homozygous is (number of ways to have homozygous)/(total possible combinations). Wait, maybe another approach: For each gene, the probability that the individual is homozygous is 1/4 (AA or aa). Since each gene pair is independent, the probability that all five are homozygous is (1/4)^5 = 1/1024. But wait, part (b) asks for the proportion of homozygous individuals among all progeny. So, each gene contributes to the total number of possible genotypes. Alternatively, the number of possible genotypes per gene is 3 (AA, Aa, aa), but since the organism is diploid for each gene, the total number of possible genotypes per gene is 3. But since there are five independent genes, the total number of possible genotypes is 3^5 = 243. Now, how many of these are homozygous? For each gene, the homozygous cases are AA and aa, which is 2 out of 3 possibilities. So, for each gene, the probability of being homozygous is 2/3, but since all genes need to be homozygous simultaneously, the probability is (2/3)^5 ≈ 0.1317, which is approximately 13.17%. However, looking at the options, none seem to match exactly. Wait, perhaps my initial reasoning was wrong. Maybe each gene pair is considered separately. For each gene, the probability of being homozygous is 1/4, so for all five, it's (1/4)^5 = 1/1024, which is about 0.09766%, which is much smaller than 13%. Hmm, conflicting results. Maybe I'm overcomplicating. Alternatively, thinking of each gene contributing to the total number of possible combinations. Each gene has 3 possibilities (AA, Aa, aa), so total is 3^5=243. The number of homozygotes is 2^5=32, since for each gene, only AA and aa are homozygous, so 2 choices per gene. Therefore, 32/243 ≈ 13.17%. Problem: Assume there is an organism in which there are five contrasting independent gene pairs, A vs. a, B vs. b, D vs. d, E vs. e and F vs. f, for which the organism is heterozygous. If the organism were able to undergo self-fertilization, (a) what is the probability that the first progeny will have a genotype identical to that of the parent? (b) what proportion of the total progeny will be homozygous? (c) assuming complete dominance for each gene pair, what proportion of the total progeny will phenotypically exhibit the dominant form for the five characters?

A. 1/1024, 1/1024, 1023/1,024

B. 1/16, 3/16, 729/1,024

C. 1/4, 1/4, 512/1,024

D. 1/8, 1/8, 121/1,024

E. 1/32, 1/32, 243/1,024

F. 1/16, 1/16, 81/1,024

H. 1/2, 1/2, 1/1,024

I. 1/32, 1/64, 255/1,024

J. 1/4, 1/8, 961/1,024

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
